page.title: 17LITTER IN EXMOUTH
page.content: When we were at Sandy Bay we did a litter survey. We found that 28% of the litter was made of plastic and so does not rot or break down. We also found some vegetable waste and glass (60 tons of litter are taken from Sandy Bay Holiday Park each week). There were a lot of cigarette ends. 20% of the litter was paper. When we returned to school we did a similar survey in the two playgrounds and the street.50% of the street litter was sweet and cigarette wrappers.The rest was waste paper and cigarette ends. There was hardly any rubbish in the infant's playground because they are not allowed food or sweets at break. Alas there was more litter to be found in the junior playground;mostly sweet and crisp wrappers. We found less litter than we expected.
